alert.note: Alert for Limestone; Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 5:01AM CDT until July 21 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Huntsville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Limestone County in north central Alabama... Northwestern Madison County in north central Alabama... * Until 800 AM CDT. * At 501 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntsville, Madison, Athens, Meridianville, Redstone Arsenal, Moores Mill, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, Harvest, Alabama A And M University, Capshaw, Toney, French Mill, Ryland, Brownsboro and Hampton Cove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
